1.text: Then Yahweh answered Job out of the whirlwind,

2.text: “Who is this who darkens counsel by words without knowledge?

3.text: Brace yourself like a man, for I will question you, then you answer me!

4.text: “Where were you when I laid the foundations of the earth? Declare, if you have understanding.

5.text: Who determined its measures, if you know? Or who stretched the line on it?

6.text: Whereupon were its foundations fastened? Or who laid its cornerstone,

7.text: when the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

8.text: “Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it broke forth from the womb,

9.text: when I made clouds its garment, and wrapped it in thick darkness,

10.text: marked out for it my bound, set bars and doors,

11.text: and said, ‘Here you may come, but no further. Here your proud waves shall be stayed?’

12.text: “Have you commanded the morning in your days, and caused the dawn to know its place;

13.text: that it might take hold of the ends of the earth, and shake the wicked out of it?

14.text: It is changed as clay under the seal, and stands forth as a garment.

15.text: From the wicked, their light is withheld. The high arm is broken.

16.text: “Have you entered into the springs of the sea? Or have you walked in the recesses of the deep?

17.text: Have the gates of death been revealed to you? Or have you seen the gates of the shadow of death?

18.text: Have you comprehended the earth in its breadth? Declare, if you know it all.

19.text: “What is the way to the dwelling of light? As for darkness, where is its place,

20.text: that you should take it to its bound, that you should discern the paths to its house?

21.text: Surely you know, for you were born then, and the number of your days is great!

22.text: Have you entered the treasuries of the snow, or have you seen the treasures of the hail,

23.text: which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?

24.text: By what way is the lightning distributed, or the east wind scattered on the earth?

25.text: Who has cut a channel for the flood water, or the path for the thunderstorm;

26.text: To cause it to rain on a land where no man is; on the wilderness, in which there is no man;

27.text: to satisfy the waste and desolate ground, to cause the tender grass to spring forth?

28.text: Does the rain have a father? Or who fathers the drops of dew?

29.text: Out of whose womb came the ice? The gray frost of the sky, who has given birth to it?

30.text: The waters become hard like stone, when the surface of the deep is frozen.

31.text: “Can you bind the cluster of the Pleiades, or loosen the cords of Orion?

32.text: Can you lead forth the constellations in their season? Or can you guide the Bear with her cubs?

33.text: Do you know the laws of the heavens? Can you establish its dominion over the earth?

34.text: “Can you lift up your voice to the clouds, That abundance of waters may cover you?

35.text: Can you send forth lightnings, that they may go? Do they report to you, ‘Here we are?’

36.text: Who has put wisdom in the inward parts? Or who has given understanding to the mind?

37.text: Who can number the clouds by wisdom? Or who can pour out the bottles of the sky,

38.text: when the dust runs into a mass, and the clods of earth stick together?

39.text: “Can you hunt the prey for the lioness, or satisfy the appetite of the young lions,

40.text: when they crouch in their dens, and lie in wait in the thicket?

41.text: Who provides for the raven his prey, when his young ones cry to God, and wander for lack of food?
